roleset.name: look at, observe
roleset.note: WATCH-V NOTES: Member of Vncls sight-30.2, search-35.2. (from watch.01-v)

WATCHING-N NOTES: Based on Bolt data. Comparison to watch.01-v. Watch.01-v is a member of VN classes sight-30.2 and search-35.2. Watch.01-v is a member of FN class Being_awake. Framed by Katie. (from watching.01-n)
WATCH-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on watch-v.01. Corresponds to Vncls sight-30.2, search-35.2. (from watch.01-n)

roles.note: It's possible that a benefactive argument will appear. If so, call itarg2 and send me the example. (from watch.01-v)

example.name: watch-v: transitive
example.text: But traders who *trace* watch the stocks warned the rise may be yet another ``one-day phenomenon.''

example.name: watch-v: stalker?
example.text: If anyone wants to learn about model watching or how I know this is going to happen feel free to pm me.

roleset.name: guard, be on the lookout
roleset.note: WATCH_OVER-V NOTES: Added based on Brown corpus (from watch.03-v)

example.name: watch_over-v
example.text: The US was watching over Chinese markets

example.name: watch-n: both args
example.text: Harry Pearce and his Watch over the Embassy in Dakar.

example.name: keep_watch-l: arg1
example.text: []Our compatriots]-1 must continue *PRO*-1 to keep close watch over the judiciary and voice their expectations .

example.name: stand_watch-l
example.text: One-1 is supposed *PRO*-1 to stand watch while the other eats .

roleset.name: erwarten sich
roleset.note: WATCH_OUT-V NOTES: There's just not a nice way to say that in English. (from watch.02-v)

example.name: look out!
example.text: ``[You]-1 have *trace*-1 to watch out for counterbids,'' said one analyst.
